entry.title: SHERIFF HANLIN JOINS 33 OTHER OREGON SHERIFF’S SEEKING CLARIFICATION ON ICE
entry.summary: August 30, 2025 7:30 a.m. Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin has joined 33 other Oregon Sheriff’s in signing a letter asking for legal clarity on U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement immigration subpoenas. Wednesday’s letter went to Marion County’s legal counsel, Oregon Attorney General Dan Rayfield and United States Attorney General Pam Bondi. A release from...

entry.title: UPTD ANNOUNCES TEMPORARY SERVICE REDUCTIONS
entry.summary: (photo credit: Patrick Moore) August 30, 2025 7:00 a.m. On Friday, the Umpqua Public Transportation District announced that it will be reducing services beginning September 15th, following significant delays in both federal and state funding allocations. UPTD Chief Operations Officer George Carrillo said, “These reductions were not a choice but a necessity”. Carrillo said, “This...

entry.title: Umpqua Public Transportation District announces temporary service reductions
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — According to a press release from Umpqua Public Transportation District (UPTD), transportation service reductions will start Sept. 15 across five bus lines. The UPTD Board of Directors voted to implement the changes on Aug. 27.

entry.title: Road resurfacing to take place in southeast Roseburg next week
entry.summary: Starting Sept. 3, the city of Roseburg is scheduled to begin days of road resurfacing work in Southeast Roseburg, maintaining and restoring the surface of 2.6 miles of road following weather delays that postponed the work.

entry.title: Bandon Man Indicted on Hundreds of Charges Tied to Game Park Investigation
entry.summary: A Bandon man has been indicted on 371 charges tied to the West Coast Game Park, including hundreds of animal neglect counts, wildlife violations, drug crimes, and unlawful possession of a machine gun. Prosecutors also added a felony racketeering charge.

entry.title: Northbound lanes of I-5 closed at exit 163
